intro: Denhamia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved denhamia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
